Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.matveev.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.matveev.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler, info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler, info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
Class, that implements interface or class, that is defined by token

    • getDefaultValue

      private String getDefaultValue(Class<?> token)
      Returns some value (in String format), which can be used for token instantiation.
      Parameters:
      token - Class token, for which we want to find correct instantiation
      Returns:
      Correct instantiation
      Since:

    • indent

      private String indent(String s, int indentCount)
      Adds indention in the begining of s. One indent is 4 spaces.
      Parameters:
      s - String, to which we're adding indention
      indentCount - Number of indentions to be added
      Returns:
      Modified string with indentions
      Since:
      21

      Parameters:

      parameters - Array of function parameters
      Throws:

    • writeMethodHead

      private void writeMethodHead(Writer writer, Executable executable, String returnType, String methodName) throws IOException
      Writes method head in format "public returnType methodName(Type1 name1, ...)".
      Parameters:
      writer - Writer that is used to write
      executable - Constructor or method for which we're writing head
      returnType - Method return Type, for constructors, it must be empty string
      methodName - Constructor/Method name
      Throws:
      IOException - If writer fails to write
      Since:
      21

    • writeReturn

      private void writeReturn(Writer writer, Method method) throws IOException
      Writes body of method. The body consists of one return statement, that returns getDefaultValue(Class) Basically, it's just return getDefaultValue(method.getReturnType()).
      Parameters:
      writer - Writer that is used to write
      method - Method, whose body we're implementing
      Throws:
      IOException - If writer fails to write
      Since:
      21

    • writeMethod

      private void writeMethod(Writer writer, Method method) throws IOException
      Writes implementation of method.
      Parameters:
      writer - Writer that is used to write
      method - Method, which we're implementing
      Throws:
      IOException - If writer fails to write
      Since:
      21

    • writeClassHead

      private void writeClassHead(Writer writer, Class<?> token) throws IOException
      Writes head of class/interface. It will be class or interface depends on your token. The class name will be equal to String.format("%sImpl", token.getSimpleName()). The class/interface that our class extends/implements is defined by token.
      Parameters:
      writer - Writer that is used to write
      token - Class/interface that our new class extends/interface
      Throws:
      IOException - If writer fails to write
      Since:
      21

    • getConstructors

      private List<Constructor<?>> getConstructors(Class<?> token) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Returns non-private constructors of given class token. Token must be implementable or extendable, otherwise ImplerException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      token - Class, which constructors are returned
      Returns:
      Non-private constructors of token
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If token is not interface and has no non-private constructors
      Since:
      21

    • implementClass

      private void implementClass(Writer writer, Class<?> token) throws IOException, info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Writes implementation of class token.
      Parameters:
      writer - Writer that is used to write
      token - Class that we're extending
      Throws:
      IOException - If writer fails to write
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If it's impossible to extend token: some methods have private return type, or private arguments, that we can't access
      Since:
      21

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Main function that writes implementation of your class. Creates file with name "YouClassName{Impl}.java" which contains implementation of your class. If user give -jar option, then creating jar file "YouClassName{Impl}.jar".
      Parameters:
      args - Parameters in format "-jar className jarFile.jar" for jar implementing or "className path/to/implementation" for simple implementation without jar
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If it's impossible to extend/implement your class/file: 1) Your arguments are in wrong format 2) It's impossible to find class, that you want to be implemented 3) Your "path/to/implementation" is invalid 4) Other exception that can be thrown by implementJar() or implement()
      Since:
      21
      See Also:
      • implement(Class, Path)
      • implementJar(Class, Path)

    • checkIfCanImplement

      private void checkIfCanImplement(Class<?> token) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Checks if it is possible to implement class token
      Parameters:
      token - Class, that is to be checked
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If it is not possible, that is, if one of the following conditions are tru: 1) Record.class.equals(token) || Enum.class.equals(token) 2) token.isEnum() 3) Modifier.isPrivate(token.getModifiers()) 4) token.isPrimitive() 5) Modifier.isFinal(token.getModifiers())
      Since:
      21

    • implement

      public void implement(Class<?> token, Path root) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Creates implementation for class/interface token. Creates file in root with name String.format("%sImpl", token.getSimpleName()), which contains implementation of token.
      Specified by:
      implement in interface info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      root - root directory, where implementation will be stored.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If it's impossible to implement token: 1) token.equals(Record.class) or token.equals(Enum.class) 2) token is not interface or class 3) token is Final 4) token is Private 5) token is Utility class 6) If some IOException occurred, like failing to create file, or failing to write in a file
      Since:
      21
      See Also:
      • Impler.implement(Class, Path)

      private static String getClassPath()
      Returns path to BaseImplementor class.
      Returns:
      path to BaseImplementor class

      21

    • compile

      private static void compile(Path root, List<String> files, Charset charset)
      Compiles ".java" files.
      Parameters:
      root - Path where files are stored
      files - Names of files
      charset - Charset that is used to compile files
      Since:
      21

    • resolvePackages

      private Path resolvePackages(Class<?> token, Path root)
      Adds directories to root. Transforms token.getPackage() to path, and then concatenates root with this path
      Parameters:
      token - Class, whose packages we will use to resolve root
      root - Directory, that we want to resolve
      Returns:
      Resolved directory root
      Since:
      21

    • getOutputFilePath

      private Path getOutputFilePath(Class<?> token, Path root, String extension)
      Resolves packages on root, then adds file with implementation to the end of the path
      Parameters:
      token - Class, that we're implementing
      root - Directory, where implementation file is stored
      extension - Extension that will be added to implementation file
      Returns:
      Path to implementation file
      Since:
      21

    • implementJar

      public void implementJar(Class<?> token, Path jarFile) throws info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException
      Creates jar file, containing implementation of class token. Jar file located in jarFile.
      Specified by:
      implementJar in interface info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
      Parameters:
      token - type token to create implementation for.
      jarFile - target .jar file.
      Throws:
      info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.ImplerException - If implement(token, root) throws ImplerException
      Since:
      21
      See Also:
      • JarImpler.implementJar(Class, Path)
